title: Same Tree
description: Given the roots of two binary trees p and q, check if they are the same tree.
constraints: The number of nodes in both trees is in the range [0, 100]

templates.python:
class TreeNode:
    def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):
        self.val = val
        self.left = left
        self.right = right

class Solution:
    def isSameTree(self, p, q):
        # Your code here
        return False

# Driver code - DO NOT MODIFY
from collections import deque

def buildTree(data):
    if data == "[]":
        return None
    values = data[1:-1].split(',')
    root = TreeNode(int(values[0].strip()))
    queue = deque([root])
    i = 1
    while queue and i < len(values):
        node = queue.popleft()
        if values[i].strip() != "null":
            node.left = TreeNode(int(values[i].strip()))
            queue.append(node.left)
        i += 1
        if i < len(values) and values[i].strip() != "null":
            node.right = TreeNode(int(values[i].strip()))
            queue.append(node.right)
        i += 1
    return root

if __name__ == "__main__":
    p_input = input().strip()
    q_input = input().strip()
    p = buildTree(p_input)
    q = buildTree(q_input)
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.isSameTree(p, q)
    print(result)
